content.description: Furthest route on the right. Easy climbing to anchor.
Another fun warm-up romp with stemming, terraced climbing, and chossy jugs oh my!!!
content.location: To the left of "Heart of Darkness"

content.description: Hard move off the deck to make the first clip, and another hard sequence to make the second clip. Very sequential and height dependent move to make the third clip. Sustained through the next two clips, and easier terrain to the anchor. The anchor on this route is a indoor gym type clip anchor designed for TR. Full sustained value at the grade!
content.location: Sunnyside  crags just left of Dr Know. Start in the overhanging cave type area.

content.description:
Just left of "cheap lipstick" and slightly right of a crack.  Better quality rock than the neighboring "cheap lipstick".  Fun enough if looking for something easy, short and in the sun.

Mayr guidebook indicates 5.8 - that's a bit of a stretch.
content.protection: 3 bolts - shares ring anchor with "cheap lipstick"
content.location:
Dirty slot corridor facing the road.  Just right of hook bush.

Mayr guide - route 820

content.description: Start on jugs traversing left to a shelf. Then launch up the face on mostly good holds... Still a little crispy, but should clean up with some traffic.
content.location: Around the corner from "My Son", starting right of the bush.

content.description: AKA The Easiest Route at NJC... Fun romp up big holds. Great 1st lead!!!
content.location: 1st route over the fence from the Parking Lot Crag.

content.description:
Start up a corner to the ledge... Clip the 2nd bolt then trend right (gingerly), to avoid the heart of darkness. Clip the 3rd bolt and pull the crux in the seam. Then fun, juggy climbing to the top.

Still cleaning up, but worth a romp. Tread lightly between the 2nd and 3rd bolts.

If you've got time for one more route with southern exposure this may be a good bet.  Route follows obvious bolt line to summit and provides fun and positive holds.  Vertical but not steep and gets that "one more" route in.  Much better than its sister "Dr. Know" which is found to the left.
content.location: Middle route on south face of Sunnyside sandwiched between "Dr.Know - .10b" and "Walk in the Park - .8"  SCSG 3rd edition route 825

content.description: Follow dihedral up bolt line to anchor.  Positive holds and nice route for the grade.
content.location: Just left of overhanging 12 a on west face.  Route starts in bolted dihedral.   SCSG 3rd edition route 822

content.description: Route is easily identifiable by bolt line.  All bolts seem to clip from the left.  This route is awkward and you are nearly forced to use one arm gastons.  Extremely difficult to see holds and bolts during low sun in the winter.
content.location: First route on left on south face of Sunnyside crag - directly next to .12a "Red Hot".

content.description: Climb up bolt protected boulder to ledge. Long reach or magic feet to gain well chalked flake.  Use positive flake then finger crack to gain footing.  Follow bolt line to anchors.  Fun!
content.location: Start just below large bolt protected boulder.  Large boulder for viewing directly behind the start of this route.  SCSG 3rd edition route 821

content.description:
This route is described in the Mayr guide as 5.9* - Rock quality is suspect, 1st bolt is ridiculously low and to in my opinion didn't have a single .9 move on it.  Saying it's .7 is generous.

It does however have sunny exposure and no approach.  Bring a ropebag as the belay is dusty and dirty.
content.protection: 6 bolts to ring anchors (which share with "power puff")
content.location:
South facing wall - furthest route on the left (while facing the wall) starts in a dirty narrow slot in front of a hook bush.  First bolt is 4' from the ground and painted red.

Mayr guide - route 819
